ch.se.inf.ethz.jcd.batman.server

Interface IRemoteVirtualDisk

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Remote
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ISimpleVirtualDisk, ISynchronizeServer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RemoteVirtualDisk, SimpleVirtualDisk, SynchronizeServer

    public interface IRemoteVirtualDisk
extends Remote

    • Method Detail

      • unloadDisk

        void unloadDisk(int id)
                throws RemoteException,
                       VirtualDiskException
        Unloads the virtual disk represented by the given ID. A disk unload will also close the disk on the remote host.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing the loaded virtual disk that should be unloaded
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getFreeSpace

        long getFreeSpace(int id)
                  throws RemoteException,
                         VirtualDiskException
        Returns the amount of free space inside the virtual disk. This value does not indicate how much data the disk can hold in the future as the virtual disk may be elastic and would resize itself to fit more data inside.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        Returns:
        the amount of free space in bytes
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getOccupiedSpace

        long getOccupiedSpace(int id)
                      throws RemoteException,
                             VirtualDiskException
        Returns the amount of occupied space inside the virtual disk. This represents the amount of stored bytes inside the virtual disk.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        Returns:
        the amount in bytes
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getUsedSpace

        long getUsedSpace(int id)
                  throws RemoteException,
                         VirtualDiskException
        Returns the amount of bytes the virtual disk takes on the disk of the host system.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        Returns:
        the amount in bytes
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • createFile

        void createFile(int id,
              File file)
                throws RemoteException,
                       VirtualDiskException
        Creates an empty file on the remote virtual disk.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        file - the file that should be created
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • createDirectory

        void createDirectory(int id,
                   Directory directory)
                     throws RemoteException,
                            VirtualDiskException
        Creates a directory on the remote virtual disk.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        directory - the directory to create
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • deleteEntry

        void deleteEntry(int id,
               Entry entry)
                 throws RemoteException,
                        VirtualDiskException
        Deletes a virtual disk entry (file or directory).
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        entry - the entry to delete
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • write

        void write(int id,
         File file,
         long fileOffset,
         byte[] data)
           throws RemoteException,
                  VirtualDiskException
        Writes the given data into the given file.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        file - the file to write into
        fileOffset - the offset inside the file from where to start writing. The offset is in bytes and inclusive
        data - the data to write
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • read

        byte[] read(int id,
          File file,
          long fileOffset,
          int length)
            throws RemoteException,
                   VirtualDiskException
        Reads from a file
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        file - the file to read from
        fileOffset - the offset inside the file from where to start reading. The offset is in bytes and inclusive
        length - the amount of bytes to read
        Returns:
        the read data
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getChildren

        Entry[] getChildren(int id,
                  Entry entry)
                    throws RemoteException,
                           VirtualDiskException
        Returns all child entries for the given entry. This will (for now) only return child entries if the given entry is a directory.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        entry - the parent entry of the returned children
        Returns:
        array of children of the given parent entry
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getAllChildrenBelow

        Entry[] getAllChildrenBelow(int id,
                          Entry entry)
                            throws RemoteException,
                                   VirtualDiskException
        Returns all entries below the given entry in the virtual disk entries tree.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        entry - the parent entry
        Returns:
        array of all children below the given parent entry in the tree
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • moveEntry

        void moveEntry(int id,
             Entry entry,
             Entry newEntry)
               throws RemoteException,
                      VirtualDiskException
        Moves the given entry to the new location. This can be used to move entries around or/and rename them.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        entry - the entry to move
        newPath - the destination of the move
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • entriesExist

        boolean[] entriesExist(int id,
                     Path[] entryPaths)
                       throws RemoteException,
                              VirtualDiskException
        Checks if the given paths exist.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        entryPaths - paths to check if they exist
        Returns:
        indicates if the path with the same index exists. True if it exists, otherwise false
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getEntries

        Entry[] getEntries(int id,
                 Path[] entryPaths)
                   throws RemoteException,
                          VirtualDiskException
        Returns the entries representing the given paths.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        entryPaths - an array of paths to get the entries for
        Returns:
        array of entries representing the path with the same array index
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • copyEntry

        void copyEntry(int id,
             Entry source,
             Entry destination)
               throws RemoteException,
                      VirtualDiskException
        Copies the specified entry to the new destination.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        source - the source entry
        destination - the destination path, to which the source entry should be copied
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • search

        Entry[] search(int id,
             String term,
             boolean isRegex,
             boolean checkFiles,
             boolean checkFolders,
             boolean isCaseSensitive,
             boolean checkChildren,
             Entry[] parents)
               throws RemoteException,
                      VirtualDiskException
        Searches for the given term inside the given parents.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID representing a loaded virtual disk
        term - the search term
        isRegex - true if term is a regex, otherwise false
        checkFiles - true if files should be checked
        checkFolders - true if folders should be checked
        isCaseSensitive - true if term is case sensitive
        checkChildren - true if children and subfolders should be checked
        parents - list of parents to search in
        Returns:
        array of found entries
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • getAdditionalDiskInformation

        byte[] getAdditionalDiskInformation(int id)
                                    throws RemoteException,
                                           VirtualDiskException
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • saveAdditionalDiskInformation

        void saveAdditionalDiskInformation(int id,
                                 byte[] information)
                                   throws RemoteException,
                                          VirtualDiskException
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

      • updateLastModified

        Entry updateLastModified(int id,
                       Entry entry,
                       long newTimestamp)
                         throws RemoteException,
                                VirtualDiskException
        Throws:
        RemoteException
        VirtualDiskException

                  IRemoteDiskClient client)
                    throws RemoteException
        Throws:
        RemoteException

                    IRemoteDiskClient client)
                      throws RemoteException
        Throws:
        RemoteException

                 throws RemoteException,
                        InterruptedException

        RemoteException

                 throws RemoteException
        Throws:
